notesStmt.note: First and last pages are partly stained. Vanilla-dotted hair side of the folios.

Doodling and previous owners' notes on folio 231v. Natan Margalit, inscribed in a note, with a date of 18 Tevet 602 (31 December 1841), folio 231v. Antonio Francesco Enriquez, active in 1683-1688 in Urbino, inscribed with a date of 1680 (1687?), folio 231v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Torah ʿim perush Rash"i תורה עם פרוש רש"י

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script, not punctuated, of the 15th century. Shelomoh ben Mosheh ben Shelomoh ha-Rofeʾ : inscribed in the colophon, folio 231r.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Rashi. Commentary on the Pentateuch. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 19,653.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: John (sic!) Finn, most probably James Finn (b. 1806, d. 1872), British Consul in Jerusalem 1846-1863: purchased by the British Museum on 13 November 1852; received 01 November 1853: inscribed, [234v].
